applications.name: Microsoft Word
applications.description: Microsoft Word is a word processing application used for creating, editing, and formatting documents including letters, reports, and professional publications.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open the file browser dialog where you can select a document to open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog title and place focus in the file list. Use arrow keys to navigate files.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current document. If the document is new, this opens the Save As dialog.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce save confirmation or open the Save As dialog for new documents.

shortcuts.description: Press F12 to open the Save As dialog where you can choose a new location or filename for your document.
shortcuts.notes: Focus moves to the file name field. Screen readers will announce the dialog and current file name.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open the print dialog where you can select printer settings and print your document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the print dialog and available options. Tab through controls to adjust settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close the current document. You will be prompted to save if there are unsaved changes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce any save prompt before closing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to create a new blank document in a new window.
shortcuts.notes: Focus moves to the new blank document. Screen readers will announce the new document.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then F to open the File backstage view where you can access save, open, print, and other file operations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the backstage view menu. Use arrow keys to navigate options.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is in a word
shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make the selected text bold or toggle bold off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce bold formatting when applied, depending on verbosity settings. NVDA announces this with appropriate speech.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is in a word
shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to make the selected text italic or toggle italic off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce italic formatting when verbosity is set to report formatting changes.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is in a word
shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline the selected text or toggle underline off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce underline formatting depending on user settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 5 together to apply or remove strikethrough formatting on selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Most screen readers will not automatically announce strikethrough. Use formatting review commands to check.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Equals together to format text as subscript, which appears below the baseline.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce subscript formatting when reading character attributes.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Equals together to format text as superscript, which appears above the baseline.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce superscript when reading character attributes or when verbosity is high.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F together to place focus in the font dropdown where you can type or select a font name.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the font dropdown and current font. Type to filter fonts or use arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and P together to place focus in the font size dropdown where you can select or type a size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the font size dropdown and current size value.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Right Bracket together to increase the font size by one point.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the new font size depending on verbosity settings.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Left Bracket together to decrease the font size by one point.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the new font size when format reporting is enabled.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F3 together to cycle through text case options: sentence case, lowercase, uppercase, and title case.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not typically announce case changes automatically. Use review commands to verify.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Spacebar together to remove all character formatting and return text to default paragraph style.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will not announce formatting removal. Use attribute reporting to verify plain text.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then I to open the text highlight color menu where you can select a highlight color.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the highlight color palette. Use arrow keys to navigate colors.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then F then C to open the font color picker where you can select a text color.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the color picker. Colors may be described by name or RGB values.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and E together to center align the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce alignment change when reading paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to left align the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce left alignment when paragraph attributes are read.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and R together to right align the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce right alignment when checking paragraph formatting.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and J together to justify the current paragraph so text aligns to both left and right margins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce justified alignment in paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 1 together to set the current paragraph to single line spacing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce line spacing changes depending on verbosity level.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 2 together to set the current paragraph to double line spacing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce spacing change in paragraph format details.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 5 together to set the current paragraph to one and a half line spacing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce one point five spacing when reading paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 0 together to add or remove 12 points of space before the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not typically announce spacing changes. Use paragraph formatting commands to check.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and M together to increase the left indent of the current paragraph by one level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce indent level changes depending on settings.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and M together to decrease the left indent of the current paragraph by one level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce reduced indent level when reading paragraph format.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control and T together to create a hanging indent where the first line extends left of subsequent lines.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce hanging indent in paragraph formatting details.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph with hanging indent
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and T together to reduce or remove the hanging indent.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce when hanging indent is removed.

shortcuts.context: When caret is in a paragraph
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and L together to apply default bullet formatting to the current paragraph or remove bullets if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce list item and nesting level when entering or reading a list.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to open the Insert Hyperlink dialog where you can enter a URL and link text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the hyperlink dialog. Focus moves to the URL field for text entry.

shortcuts.context: When caret is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter together to insert a page break at the current cursor position, moving subsequent content to the next page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce page break when navigating by character or in certain reading modes.

shortcuts.context: When caret is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Enter together to insert a line break without creating a new paragraph, keeping current formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers treat line breaks as soft returns and may not announce them distinctly from regular line endings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Spacebar together to insert a non-breaking space that prevents line breaks between words.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically read non-breaking spaces as regular spaces without distinction.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or caret is positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together to insert a comment at the current position or on selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the comment pane and place focus in the comment text field for typing.

shortcuts.context: When caret is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Control, and F together to insert a footnote at the current position. Focus moves to the footnote area.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce footnote reference number and move focus to footnote text entry area.

shortcuts.context: When caret is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Control, and D together to insert an endnote at the current position. Focus moves to the endnote area.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce endnote reference number and move to endnote text entry area.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N to activate the Insert tab ribbon where you can access insertion commands using additional key presses.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce Insert tab activation. Continue with letter keys for specific commands.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then T to open the table insertion interface where you can specify table dimensions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce table grid or dialog. Use arrow keys or Tab to set rows and columns.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then P then F to open the file browser where you can select an image file to insert.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the file picker dialog. Navigate files with arrow keys and insert with Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to move the cursor to the beginning of the current line.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the first character or word when cursor moves to line start.

shortcuts.description: Press End to move the cursor to the end of the current line.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the last character or may announce line end.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to move the cursor to the very beginning of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce document top and read the first line or paragraph.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to move the cursor to the very end of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce document bottom and read the last line or announce end of document.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Left Arrow together to move the cursor one word to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the previous word as cursor moves.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Right Arrow together to move the cursor one word to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the next word as cursor moves.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Up Arrow together to move the cursor to the beginning of the current or previous paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the beginning of the paragraph as cursor moves.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Down Arrow together to move the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the beginning of the next paragraph.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to open the Go To dialog where you can navigate to a specific page, section, or bookmark.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the Go To dialog. Type page number or use Tab to select navigation type.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F5 together to return to the previous editing location or cycle through recent edit positions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce new cursor position. Useful for returning after reviewing another section.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Home together to activate browse by object mode for navigating through document elements.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce browse mode. Use arrow keys to move between objects like images, tables, or headings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all content in the current document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the number of characters, words, or paragraphs selected.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to end of word
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Right Arrow together to extend selection one word to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce selected text as selection expands.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to beginning of word
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Left Arrow together to extend selection one word to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce selected text as it is added to the selection.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to end of line
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and End together to extend selection from cursor position to the end of the current line.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the selected text through to line end.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to beginning of line
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Home together to extend selection from cursor position to the beginning of the current line.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the selected text from line start to cursor.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to beginning of document
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Home together to extend selection from cursor position to the beginning of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce selection size or read selected content depending on length.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to end of document
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and End together to extend selection from cursor position to the end of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce selection extent, typically stating number of characters or paragraphs selected.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Left Arrow together to extend selection by one character to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce each selected character as selection expands.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Right Arrow together to extend selection by one character to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce each character added to the selection.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Down Arrow together to extend selection to the end of the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the selected paragraph or portion thereof.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Up Arrow together to extend selection to the beginning of the current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the selected text from paragraph start.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a word
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and W together to select the entire word where the cursor is positioned.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the selected word.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected text and place it on the clipboard for pasting elsewhere.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce that content was cut to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text to the clipboard without removing it from the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce that content was copied to clipboard.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at the current cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce pasted content or indicate paste occurred.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is positioned in document
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and V together to open Paste Special dialog where you can choose paste format options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog and available paste format options. Use arrow keys to select.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last action or edit in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce what action was undone if verbosity is high.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo the last action that was undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce what action was redone.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Backspace together to delete the word to the left of the cursor.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the deleted word or simply indicate deletion occurred.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Delete together to delete the word to the right of the cursor.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the deleted word before removal.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open the Find pane where you can search for text in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the Find pane and place focus in the search field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open the Find and Replace dialog where you can search and replace text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog and place focus in the Find field. Tab to access Replace field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to repeat the last formatting or editing action performed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce the repeated action or change.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F4 together to repeat the last find operation and jump to the previous occurrence.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the found text and its location in the document.

shortcuts.description: Press F7 to open the spelling and grammar checker pane to review and correct errors in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the pane and current error with suggestions. Use Tab to navigate options.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a word
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F7 together to open the thesaurus pane showing synonyms for the current word.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the thesaurus pane and list of synonyms. Use arrow keys to navigate.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to turn track changes on or off for collaborative editing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce whether track changes is now on or off.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together while in a comment to delete that comment.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce comment deletion and return focus to document.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Page Down together to navigate to the next comment in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read the comment text and author when navigating to comments.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Page Up together to navigate to the previous comment in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce comment content and who authored it.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Control, and P together to switch to Print Layout view showing how pages will appear when printed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce view change to Print Layout.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Control, and O together to switch to Outline view for organizing document structure with headings.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce outline view activation. Navigate by heading level using outline controls.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Control, and N together to switch to Draft view for simplified editing without page layout.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce Draft view. This view is optimal for screen reader users as it removes visual complexity.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then F to enter or exit full screen reading mode for distraction-free reading.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce reading mode. Press Escape to exit this mode.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then Q to open the zoom dialog where you can set document magnification level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce zoom dialog. Type percentage or use Tab to select preset zoom levels.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move to the next cell in the table row, or to the first cell of the next row if at row end.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce cell position, such as row 2 column 3, and read cell content.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move to the previous cell in the table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce new cell position and content when moving backward through table.

shortcuts.action: Move to first cell in row
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Home together to move to the first cell in the current table row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce first cell position and content.

shortcuts.action: Move to last cell in row
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and End together to move to the last cell in the current table row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce last cell position and content.

shortcuts.action: Move to first cell in column
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Page Up together to move to the first cell in the current table column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce cell position at top of column.

shortcuts.action: Move to last cell in column
shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Page Down together to move to the last cell in the current table column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce cell position at bottom of column.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and 5 on the numeric keypad with NumLock off to select the entire table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce that the table is selected and may state table dimensions.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in a table
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then J then L then B then E to insert a new row below the current row in the table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the new row insertion and move focus to the new row.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and I together to mark the selected text as an index entry for creating an index.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the Mark Index Entry dialog. Focus moves to entry fields.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and O together to mark selected text as a table of contents entry.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog for marking TOC entries.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is on or near a field
shortcuts.description: Press F9 to update the selected field such as table of contents, index, or cross-reference.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce field update completion. Navigate to field to hear updated content.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and F3 together to open the citation insertion dialog for academic references.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce citation dialog. Tab through fields to enter citation details.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then R then A then P to open the Accessibility Checker pane which identifies accessibility issues.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the pane and list accessibility issues found. Tab to review each issue.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Spacebar together to start or pause Read Aloud feature which speaks document text.
shortcuts.notes: This uses Word's built-in text-to-speech, separate from screen readers. May conflict with NVDA or JAWS commands.

shortcuts.context: When cursor or selection is active
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F10 together to open the context menu for the current selection or cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce context menu and available commands. Use arrow keys to navigate.

shortcuts.context: When image or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then J then P then Z to open the Alt Text pane where you can add or edit alternative text for images.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the Alt Text pane. Focus moves to the text entry field for description.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F6 together to switch to the next open Word document window.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the document name and position when switching windows.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F6 together to switch to the previous open Word document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous document name when switching.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F9 together to minimize the current Word window to the taskbar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce window minimized. Focus moves to next active window.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F5 together to restore the Word window from maximized to resizable state.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce window resize but focus remains in document.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt to display key tip badges showing letters you can press to access ribbon tabs and commands.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce key tips mode. Press displayed letters to navigate ribbon. Press Alt again to cancel.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt to move focus to the ribbon where you can navigate tabs and commands with arrow keys.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce ribbon activation and current tab. Use left and right arrows to change tabs.

shortcuts.context: When a task pane is open
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Spacebar together when focus is in a task pane to close that pane.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce pane closure. Focus returns to document.
